wordPressPost.title: How to Use this Unique Superfood to Fight Inflammation
wordPressPost.content:
Phytoplanktons are microscopic plants and bacteria that are bound to the ocean and can supply us with an unbelievable amount of nutrition. But how many of us have ever heard of them? And where do they come from?

Scientists predict that the advent of these tiny organisms are capable of converting sunlight, heat, water, and minerals into:

  • proteins,
  • carbohydrates,
  • vitamins,
  • and amino acids marks the beginning of life around 3 1/2 billion years ago.

These small organisms are called phytoplankton. The unicellular plants that form the basis of all other life forms on planet Earth. They are the “vegetation” of the ocean. Not only does it provide important food for humans, but phytoplankton is also responsible for producing up to 90% of Earth’s oxygen.

They provide us directly with vital life – as a source of valuable vitamins and minerals – and indirectly as a source of our oxygen.

What are Phytoplanktons?

Phytoplankton is the food used by the world’s largest and longest-living animals and fish. Blue whales, bowhead whales, and many other whale species eat plankton. These species live between 80 and 150 years old and retain great strength and endurance throughout their lives. The largest fish is a plankton-eating whale shark that reaches over 150 years old, and grows up to 14 meters long, weighs up to 15 tons, and is sexually active until death.

This is what phytoplankton can do for marine life, and it can do a great deal for us as well, though it is not foreseeable that each of us will live for a century and a half.

Electrolytes

The elements and electrolytes in the plankton are almost made to measure for the human body. It is not by chance that the composition of human plasma is similar to that of seawater. We emerged from the sea and our inner bodies reflect this. Our bodies need the micronutrients and trace elements found in phytoplankton to function as nature intended.

Trace minerals

On its own, the human body has a wonderful homeostasis system that keeps all systems in balance. Remove some critical components, such as a trace element, and the body malfunctions that result in suboptimal performance. Too many malfunctions can cause disease.

Phytoplankton provides many, if not all, of the trace minerals we need to maintain that balance in our bodies, helping us lead a full life in optimal health. These phytonutrients potentially show promising effects in human physiology.

Health benefits of phytoplankton in the human body

Phytoplankton contains highly concentrated lipids (fats) to improve brain function, cardiovascular function and provide a healthy cell wall.

It has been clinically shown to lower cholesterol and stabilize blood sugar levels. Phytoplankton helps to increase mental alertness. It helps reduce body pain and inflammation, both inside the body and outside. 

We know how fast phytoplankton nourishes the whole body because external problems such as dandruff, eczema, psoriasis, and dermatitis get better so quickly. Because all external skin diseases derive from internal toxicity, we know how much phytoplankton nourishes and cleanses at the cellular level.

Other health benefits:

It protects the eyes.

A very exciting feature of plankton is its ability to help the eyes, and it is shown to be more effective than lutein. Another component of the product is astaxanthin, which is also very beneficial for the eyes. Various studies show the amazing benefits of phytoplankton in supporting people with a macular degeneration due to astaxanthin.

It helps support the liver.

To restore our health, it is very necessary to detoxify and then rebuild. This whole food product does both at the same time. Phytoplankton supports a healthy liver, the largest internal organ of the body. Of course, when our liver is detoxified and strengthened, we sleep well and have more energy during our daily activities!

Phytoplankton is a whole food.

Doctors usually focus on recommending nutritional supplements to help the body get the nutrients it needs to help the body heal itself. But studies now show that instead of supplements, we can source our diet from complete whole foods, and that’s exactly what this product is.

If it can give all the food a large ocean-life mammal needs for its entire life, it can give us humans because we’re mammals too!

Overview of how phytoplanktons might benefit humans:

  • For the general diet, they contain ultra-potent lipids to improve brain function.
  • They support a healthy heart with a variety of minerals and vitamins.
  • They have been proven to stabilize blood sugar levels.
  • Phytoplankton in our diet supports us in general mental alertness and can fight ADHD, Parkinson’s and general dementia.
  • They relieve pain and inflammation in our joints.
  • Prevent psoriasis and dermatitis.
  • This super-nutrient boosts your immune system enormously.
  • Your nervous system is strengthened along with your endocrine system.
  • It helps to speed up your recovery from illness and diseases.
  • Your skin will look more vibrant and younger.
  • It is also effective in providing a natural allergy remedy.
  • It improves blood circulation and heart function.
  • It helps your body cells to protect themselves against radiation that exists in the environment.
  • Clinical tests show that phytoplankton can lower cholesterol.

For a good view, studies show that phytoplankton may be more effective than lutein. Besides, they support a healthy liver, good sleep habits, and increased energy levels.

The list of nutrients available in phytoplanktons include:

  • vitamins B12, C and E,
  • magnesium,
  • chlorophyll,
  • potassium,
  • and many other vitamins and trace minerals.

How to use phytoplanktons safely?

You can purchase Phytoplankton as a supplement in liquid form, but you can also get it in capsule or powder form. You can get it at your local health food store or online. Make sure to always read the labels before buying.

Keep in mind that the supplement can be in capsule, liquid or powder form. But then it has to be:

  • non-GMO,
  • raw,
  • unprocessed,
  • and tested for heavy metals because of the contamination and polution of ocean water.
  • If you are getting it in tablet form, then look for certain fillers; and ask as many questions as necessary to avoid getting toxic phytoplanktons. 

Most companies have whether a blog, a brochure or useful information when selling phytoplanktons supplements. So, always make sure to look for the word “GALA’. The name comes Galapagos Tortoise. This strain is the highest in Superoxide Dismutase that is responsible for longevity. 

Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) is 1000 times more potent than Vitamin C. SOD is an enzyme produced as a by-product of oxygen. It is an anti-inflammatory agent that protects the body against oxidative stress; in other words, it can help fight degenerative issues such as cancer.

If you already use concentrated green supplements as a part of your diet, then you probably will not mind putting it right under your tongue.

How to use it in your daily routine?

If it’s too strong for you, you can add it to water, or coconut water or a small amount of juice. You can also add it to your smoothies, salad dressings, homemade supplies and broths and more. Make sure to always keep phytoplankton products in a cool and dry place.

Final thought:

Phytoplankton is just a part of the equation you have to make sure to eat well and balanced. Decrease caffeine, increase water and consider getting rid of junk and processed food to feel the full benefits of this algae. Supplements can only help the problems partially; but the rest is up to a good diet, rest and a quiet mind. and daily activities.
